channel.title: Startups on c13u's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Startups on c13u's Blog

item.title: Getting Startup Ideas
item.description: How to Get Startup Ideas [] Err on the side of having competitors, but make sure that you have a thesis that everyone else is overlooking, e.g. Google wasn’t averse to users leaving google.com ASAP. The Startup Idea Matrix, ( B2B Edition , B2C Edition ) is a good start for knowing who to google. Big companies tend to be slow at changing their approach. You’d think that Yahoo!

item.title: Unorthodox Startups
item.description: The Food Delivery Mafia Google allows certain booking and ordering services from third-party providers (e.g. Doordash) to automatically appear with business listings. To edit such links, the business has to contact the third party. Complaints by restaurants: Doordash has poor service that reflects on the restaurant; sometimes owners have their own delivery service which is circumvented; Doordash charges the restaurant for orders made through them. [] It’s more likely that Doordash and Grubhub will have more technical expertise to navigate online listings - they have deep money-losing, but user-growth-fueling pockets (e.

item.title: Tech Startups Are Flooding Kenya With Apps Offering High-Interest Loans [Bloomberg]
item.description: Tech Startups Are Flooding Kenya With Apps Offering High-Interest Loans. Zeke Faux. Bloomberg New Economy. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2020-02-12/tech-startups-are-flooding-kenya-with-apps-offering-high-interest-loans . https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=22307002 . Tala’s Version of Events Empowering female entrepreneurs around the world - Mexico, Philippines, India & Kenya. 69% of global adult population is not covered by credit bureaus. Using non-traditional data, more people can get scored. Credit brings opportunity and choice. We help people be in control of their finances.

item.title: Counterintuitive Competitive Advantages [Morgan Housel]
item.description: Counterintuitive Competitive Advantages. Morgan Housel. Collaborative Fund. https://www.collaborativefund.com/blog/counterintuitive-competitive-advantages/ . Mar 13, 2019. Growing big antlers requires lots of Ca and Ph, which are rare. Small antlers were required to survive low-food winters, but big antlers were required to impress females to mate. The Irish elk spiraled to extinction. I get the analogy that Housel is trying to paint, but this seems like an oversimplification. Sure, big antlers are sexy, but if small antlers are all that’s left on the menu, I doubt female antlers will think “pass”.

item.title: Is the Lean Startup Dead? [Steve Blank]
item.description: Is the Lean Startup Dead? Steve Blank. https://steveblank.com/2018/09/05/is-the-lean-startup-dead/ . Sep 5, 2018. Katzenberg (Paramount, Disney Studios & DreamWorks) has raised $1.75b for NewTV, a startup banking on consumers wanting a subscription for 10-minute programs on mobile. They renamed to quibi.com/ . At least that makes them more searchable on Google. “NewTV” searches lead to newtv.org , a community media center for the residents of Newton, Massachusetts.

item.title: The Trajectory of Great Ideas [Morgan Housel]
item.description: The Trajectory of Great Ideas. Morgan Housel. Collaborative Fund. https://www.collaborativefund.com/blog/ideas/ . Aug 14, 2018. Sears. Blockbuster. Nokia. AOL. You had a great idea. You discovered a beautiful beach to lay on, but other people didn’t just follow you and lay down themselves; they built condos and restaurants while you were watching the sunset. Soon your great idea loses its appeal. But you put so much work into the great idea that it’s become an inseparable part of your identity.

item.title: The Average Age of a Successful Startup Founder is 45 [Harvard Business]
item.description: The Average Age of a Successful Startup Founder is 45. Harvard Business Review. https://hbr.org/2018/07/research-the-average-age-of-a-successful-startup-founder-is-45 . Jul 11, 2018. There’s a variation among industries: software tends to 40, while oil/gas/biotech tends to 47. Even Gates, Jobs, Bezos, Brin & Page had their growth rates peak when they were middle aged. Different definitions of success, e.g. employment growth, sales growth, IPO/acquisition, came to the same conclusion. VCs may not be looking for growth potential.

item.title: Why I Love B2B over B2C [Atrium]
item.description: Why I Love B2B over B2C. Justin Kan. Atrium. https://www.atrium.co/blog/b2b-vs-b2c/ . Jul 11, 2018. B2B customers will actually pay for your product. You have a clear execution path - they’ll tell you and pay for features. Companies don’t quickly flip flop between products. Consumers are too price sensitive and finicky. B2B customers are rational, and thus understandable. They care about whether a solution solves their problem and if the solution is important enough to pay for.

item.title: Why Competitive Edges Die [Morgan Housel]
item.description: Why Competitive Edges Die. Morgan Housel. Collaborative Fund. https://www.collaborativefund.com/blog/why-competitive-advantages-die/ . Feb 8, 2018. The Beginner’s Mind Being right is the enemy of staying right because it leads you to forget the way the world works. Knowing you have a competitive advantage reduces the incentive to explore other ideas, especially when those ideas conflict with your chosen strategy. The Burden of Being Profitable Nothing to lose is a wonderful thing to have.

item.title: Do Things That Don't Scale [Paul Graham]
item.description: Do Things That Don't Scale. Paul Graham. http://www.paulgraham.com/ds.html . Jul 1, 2013. Recruit manually. Don’t send links. Set them up on the spot. Ask how big the startup would be if you did the right things, not whether you’re currently changing the world. Delight your initial customers. Tim Cook can’t send handwritten notes, but you can. If you can solve the problem manually, do so while gradually automating the most pressing bottlenecks.
